questions.question_text: A student records himself singing a song for his music project. The recorded sound is converted to binary to be processed by a computer. (a) Give one input device the student can use to record the song.
(b) The student uses sound editing software to edit the recorded sound. Tick (✓) one box to show whether sound editing software is an example of application, security, system or utility software.
(c)(i) Two binary numbers stored from the recording are 00011001 and 10110100. Convert the two binary numbers to denary numbers.
(c)(ii) Convert the two binary numbers to hexadecimal numbers.
(c)(iii) A logical right shift of two places is performed on the binary number 10100100. Give the binary number that would be stored after the logical shift has taken place.
(d) The two’s complement 8-bit binary integer 11001001 is also stored. Convert the two’s complement 8-bit binary integer to denary. Show all of your working.

(e) The table contains terms and descriptions about the process of converting analogue sound to binary. Complete the table with the missing term and descriptions. (Terms include sample rate and sample resolution.)
A computer stores data temporarily in random access memory (RAM). (a) RAM is one example of primary storage. Give one other example of primary storage.
(b) Give one reason why data is only stored temporarily in the RAM.
(c) The denary numbers 19 and 230 are converted to binary numbers to be stored in the RAM. Convert the two denary numbers to binary numbers.
(d) The hexadecimal numbers 35 and 8AD are converted to binary numbers to be stored in the RAM. Convert the two hexadecimal numbers to binary numbers.

(e) The 8-bit binary numbers 01100101 and 01110000 are stored in RAM. The binary numbers are added together. Add the two binary numbers using binary addition. Give your answer in binary. You must show all your working.
(f) An overflow occurs when two other 8-bit binary numbers are added together. Explain why the overflow error occurs.

(g) The negative denary number −22 is stored in RAM. Negative denary numbers can be represented as binary using two’s complement. Give the two’s complement 8-bit binary integer that would be stored for the denary number −22. You must show all your working.

A student has an image file stored on their computer. (a) The image file was taken by a digital camera. Tick (✓) one box to show whether a digital camera is an example of an input, output, process or storage device.
(b)(i) The size of the image file is 3072 bytes. Give the size of the image file in kibibytes (KiB).
(b)(ii) State the number of nibbles in 1 byte.
(c)(i) The image file has a colour depth of 32 bits. State what is meant by a colour depth of 32 bits.
(c)(ii) The colour depth of the image file is changed to 64 bits. Explain what effect this change has on the image file.
(d) The student uses lossless compression to compress the image file. Explain how the image file is compressed using lossless compression.
Tick (✓) one box to show the smallest data storage unit.
State how many tebibytes (TiB) are equal to 2 pebibytes (PiB).
Give the name of the process that is used to reduce the size of a file.
One reason the size of a file may need reducing is so that it has a shorter transmission time. Give one other reason why the size of a file may need reducing.
The ticket system has an output device that creates a paper ticket. Identify an appropriate output device to produce the paper ticket.
Two ticket numbers are 14B and 97A. Convert the two ticket numbers from hexadecimal to binary.
Give two reasons why the ticket number is displayed as hexadecimal instead of binary.
Convert the two ticket numbers from hexadecimal to denary: 02C and 10B.
Convert the two denary numbers into hexadecimal: 109 and 415.
An image is converted to binary to be represented by a computer. Complete the table with the missing terms and definitions about representing an image.

Complete the sentences about number systems. Use the items from the list. Some items will not be used and each item is used at most once. (Bases for binary/hex, 8-bit min/max, bits per hex digit, symbols A–F.)
Add the two 8-bit binary numbers using binary addition. Give the answer in binary and show all working: 10011011 + 00010011.
Tick (✓) one box: correct definition of overflow in binary addition.
State what is meant by the colour depth of an image.
Describe the relationship between the resolution of the image and the file size of the image.
The image is compressed using lossless compression. Explain why lossless was chosen instead of lossy for this file to be downloaded and printed as a poster.
Identify one lossless method of compressing an image and describe the method.
Explain how a file is broken down into packets and transmitted over a network.
Complete and annotate the diagram to show the difference between serial full-duplex transmission (between two computers) and parallel simplex transmission (between two computers).
Tick (✓) one box to show which of the following is the largest unit of data storage.
A computer has primary storage. Give one example of primary storage. Explain the purpose of your chosen example.
Calculate the binary number for the denary number 175. Show all your working.
Give the binary number for the given hexadecimal numbers: 15, 2D, 091.

Add the two binary integers using binary addition. Show all your working. Give your answer in binary.
11100011 + 11001100
Calculate the denary number for the two’s complement binary integer 10001110. Show all your working.
Give one similarity between hexadecimal and binary.
Give two differences between hexadecimal and binary.

Give the binary number for each of the three denary numbers.
15
180
235

Give the hexadecimal number for each of the three denary numbers.
14
100
250
Describe the process of the logical left shift that is performed on the binary integer.
State what effect this will have on the binary integer.
Give the name of the number system that can be used to represent negative binary integers.
Identify the name of the smallest unit of measurement of data.
State how many nibbles there are in 2 bytes.

A 10 second sound effect is recorded for a movie. It is recorded with a sample rate of 22,016 Hz and a sample resolution of 8 bits. Calculate the file size of the sound effect in kibibytes (KiB). Show all your working.
State what is meant by file compression.
Give one benefit of compressing the file for storage.
Identify one other character set that could be used to convert the text to binary.

Convert the two denary ASCII numbers to binary.
65
109

Convert the two denary ASCII numbers to hexadecimal.
65
109
Convert the binary ASCII number 01111001 to denary.
Convert the binary ASCII number 01111001 to hexadecimal.
A logical right shift of two places is performed on the binary ASCII number 01111001. Give the binary number after the shift.

The character ‘T’ is represented by the binary ASCII number 01010100. The character ‘t’ is represented by the binary ASCII number 01110100. Add the two binary numbers using binary addition. Give your answer in binary. Show all your working.
Tick (✓) one box to show which of these is not a unit of measurement for a file.
Give two types of compression that can be used to reduce the size of a file.
Give three benefits of reducing the size of a file for storage and transmission.
State what is meant by the image resolution.
State what is meant by the image colour depth.
Give one benefit of increasing the colour depth of the image.
Identify which compression method the photographer uses when the method permanently reduces the colour depth and resolution of the image.
Give two other benefits of compressing the image, besides reducing storage space.
Give one benefit of using a higher sample rate to record the song.
Give one drawback of using a higher sample rate to record the song.
Describe what is meant by sample resolution.
Identify the compression method that should be used.
Explain how the analogue sound is recorded and converted to digital.
State two ways that the accuracy of the recording could be increased.
Explain why the musician would choose to use lossless compression instead of lossy compression.
Explain the differences between the ASCII character set and the Unicode character set.
State what is meant by the sample rate and sample resolution.
Identify which type of compression has been used to compress the sound file.
Identify two pieces of data that would be included in the header of each packet in packet switching.
Explain how the file is transmitted using packet switching.
Convert the binary number 10101110 to denary.
Convert the binary number 10101110 to hexadecimal.
Give the 8-bit binary number that would be stored after a logical left shift of three places is performed on 10101110.
Tick (✓) one box to show which statement is true about the impact of the logical left shift on the binary number.
Add the two 8-bit binary numbers 11101110 and 00110001 using binary addition. Give your answer in binary. Show all your working.
Calculate the least number of bits that can be used to store the denary number 301.
Calculate the least number of bits that can be used to store the hexadecimal number A4D.
Convert the address A2F to binary.
Convert the address A2F to denary.
Convert the binary number 000110011011 to hexadecimal.
Convert the binary number 000110011011 to denary.
Give one reason why the addresses are displayed in hexadecimal instead of binary.
Identify two other ways that hexadecimal is used in computer science.
A character has a health value of –25. Calculate the two’s complement 8-bit integer for –25. Show all your working.
State what is meant by a 16-bit colour depth.
The resolution of the image is changed to 750 × 1500 pixels. Give the effect this will have on the file size of the image.
State how many bits there are in a byte.
State how many kibibytes (KiB) there are in 2 mebibytes (MiB).
Identify the unit of data that is equal to 4 bits.
Give the name of the number system that is base 16.
Three denary numbers are entered into a computer. The computer converts the numbers and stores them as binary. Give the binary number that would be stored for each of the denary numbers: 10, 50, 201.
Explain why the data is converted to binary by the computer.
The two binary integers 00110000 and 01100110 are added together. Add the binary integers using binary addition and show your answer in binary. Show all your working.
The denary integer –32 is stored as a two’s complement integer. Calculate the two’s complement integer that would be stored. Show all your working.
Give the name of the data storage measurement that is equal to 8 bits.
State how many bits there are in a kibibyte (KiB).
Give the name of the data storage measurement that is equal to 1024 gibibytes (GiB).
A 16-bit colour image has a resolution of 512 pixels wide by 512 pixels high. Calculate the file size of the image in kibibytes (KiB). Show all your working.
Give the 8-bit binary number that will be stored after a logical left shift of three places is performed on the binary number 10100011.
Tick (✓) one box to show which statement about a logical left shift of two places is correct.
Convert the two’s complement integer 10100011 to denary. Show all your working.
State how many bytes there are in a kibibyte (KiB).
Convert the denary number 236 into hexadecimal.
Give one benefit of using hexadecimal instead of binary to represent data.
Convert the two’s complement integer 10110111 into denary. Show all your working.
Convert the denary number 45 into an 8-bit two’s complement integer.
State the mathematical effect of a right shift of four places on a positive binary integer.
Tick one box to show the reason why computers use binary to represent data.
Tick one box to identify the ASCII denary number for the character 'Q'.
Give the binary number for the ASCII denary number for 'N'.
Explain how the word 'RED' is represented using a character set.
Explain why recording sound with a higher sampling resolution creates a more accurate recording.
Give one other way that the accuracy of a sound recording can be improved.
Describe how the text is converted to binary to be processed by the computer.
State what effect lossless compression has on the file size.
Describe how lossless compression compresses the text file.
Give two reasons why the text file may have been compressed.
Convert the two binary numbers to hexadecimal.
A value is stored as a binary number in a register. A logical right shift of three places is performed on the binary number.
Complete the binary register to show its contents after this logical right shift.
State one effect this logical shift has on the binary number.
Tick (✔) one box to show which statement about the binary number system is correct.
Convert these three denary numbers to 8‑bit binary numbers: 50, 102, 221.
Complete the binary register for the denary number –78 using two’s complement.
Add the two 8‑bit binary numbers 00110011 and 01100001 using binary addition. Give your answer in binary.
Explain why an overflow error occurs when two binary numbers are added by a computer.
Explain what is meant by a binary number system.
Convert the denary numbers 14, 59, and 234 to binary.
Convert the denary numbers 9, 26, and 65 to hexadecimal.
Convert the positive denary number 123 to 8-bit binary using two’s complement. Show all your working.
Add the binary values 00110011 and 01111000 using binary addition. Give your answer in binary. Show all your working.
Give the denary number for the binary number stored in the register.
Give the hexadecimal number for the binary number stored in the register.
A logical left shift of two places is performed on the binary number stored in the register. Complete the binary register to show its contents after this logical left shift.
The negative denary number −99 needs to be stored in the register. Complete the register to show the binary number that would be stored, using two’s complement. Show all your working.
The number 01001100 is added to 11100011. Add the two 8-bit binary numbers, using binary addition. Give your answer in binary. Show all your working.
Give the parking cost that would be displayed on the payment machine when the registers store: register 1: 00010001, register 2: 01000110.
Give the 8-bit binary numbers that are stored in the registers to display the parking cost of $14.98.
Give the hexadecimal ticket number that would be displayed on a customer’s ticket when the binary number 1010000000111101 is stored.
Explain why data input into the payment machine needs to be converted to binary.
Describe the role of the microprocessor in the system and how it checks whether the parking cost has been paid.

Data is sent from an employee’s computer to a server. The data is correct when it is sent, but an error is detected when the data is received. (a) Describe how an error can occur in the data during transmission.

(b) Methods of error detection and correction can be added to make sure that errors are identified after data is transmitted. Complete the statements about methods of error detection and correction using terms from the list (e.g., parity even/odd, parity bit, echo check, ARQ, acknowledgement, timeout, positive/negative).
The data is sent using serial full-duplex data transmission. Give two reasons why serial full-duplex is a suitable data transmission method for the data.
Give one improvement that would be made to the data transmission if parallel transmission is used instead of serial transmission.
A checksum is used to check the data for errors after transmission. Describe the process of the checksum error detection method.
Identify one other error detection method that could be used to check for errors in the data.
Packets are transmitted across the internet. Tick (✓) one box to show which item would not be included in a packet’s header.
The packets of data may need to be reordered when they arrive at the computer in the restaurant kitchen. Explain why the packets of data may need to be reordered.
State the effect the compression has on the report file.
Give two benefits of compressing the report file before emailing it.
The employee decides to use lossless compression to compress the file. Explain why lossy compression is not suitable.
State what Unicode is an example of.
Give two advantages of the computer using Unicode instead of ASCII.
Give one disadvantage of the computer using Unicode instead of ASCII.
Circle three items of data that can be found in the packet header.
Tick (✓) one box to show the name of this method of sending packets.
A hardware device is used to control the path that each packet takes. Give the name of this hardware device.
Explain how the echo check is used to check for errors in the email data.
Explain why the values not matching in a checksum would show an error has occurred.
Give one reason why the email data is encrypted.
Give one similarity between symmetric encryption and asymmetric encryption.
Give two differences between symmetric encryption and asymmetric encryption.
Explain how the barcode scanning system operates to check for errors.
Explain how the data is sent using serial simplex data transmission.
Explain why serial simplex is the most appropriate method of data transmission for this purpose.
Give two error detection methods that could be used for this purpose.
Describe the structure of a packet of data for the email.
Explain the reasons why the company have chosen parallel full-duplex data transmission to send the data across the network.
Give two drawbacks of the company using this method of data transmission.
Give one other method of data transmission the company could have chosen.
Complete the table by giving the correct error detection method for each statement.
Tick (✓) one box to show which of the terms is not a method for transmitting data.
Data is broken down into smaller units to be transmitted from one device to another. Give the name of the unit that data is broken down into.
Explain how data is encrypted using symmetric encryption.
Give the purpose of encryption.
Tick (✓) one box to show which statement about the hexadecimal number system is incorrect.
Convert the three denary numbers to hexadecimal: 20, 32, 165.
State the purpose of encrypting data.
Describe the differences between symmetric and asymmetric encryption.
Identify two items of data contained in a packet header.
Give the purpose of a router in the packet-switching process.
Describe how the photographs would be transmitted using serial data transmission.
Give two benefits of transmitting the photographs using serial data transmission.
State one benefit of the student using parallel data transmission instead of serial data transmission.
State the name of the device that forwards the data towards its correct destination on the network.
Describe what is meant by cloud storage.
Give one disadvantage of storing the photographs in cloud storage instead of storing them locally.
Complete the table by identifying which data transmission methods are described.
Give one reason an error may occur when data is transmitted.
Tick (✔) one box to show which error detection method does not use a calculated value to check for errors.
Explain how an ARQ operates using a positive acknowledgement method.

A company employee is editing a video for the company’s website. Data is stored in the random access memory (RAM) when the video is edited. The RAM becomes full and pages of data are transmitted to a partitioned section of the secondary storage to stop the computer from crashing. (a) Give the name of the partitioned section of the secondary storage that is used in this process.

(b) The secondary storage is a hard disk drive (HDD). An HDD is an example of magnetic storage. One feature of magnetic storage is that it uses platters. Give three other features of magnetic storage.
(c) Give the reasons why an HDD is an example of secondary storage.

A computer with a Von Neumann architecture has several hardware components. (a) Complete the table with the missing terms and descriptions about computer hardware. (Includes MAC address, register, clock, control unit (CU), and the processing unit within the CPU that can fetch, decode and execute instructions.)
(b) Identify three registers that are used in the fetch stage of the fetch–decode–execute (FDE) cycle.
(c) Circle the two buses that are used in the fetch stage of the FDE cycle. (Options include: binary, control, denary, data, information, hardware, software.)

An employee uses a computer that has a Von Neumann architecture to complete many different tasks. (a) The computer has a central processing unit (CPU). Complete the table of components in the CPU and their descriptions (control unit, ALU, cache, program counter, clock, buffer).
(b) The computer is an example of a general purpose computer and not an embedded system. Explain why the computer is not an embedded system.
Complete the table with the missing terms and definitions about processing data (CIR, ALU, instruction set, cache, accumulator).
Identify the component in the CPU that is responsible for decoding an instruction.
Explain how the clock speed can affect the performance of a CPU.
Identify one other example of primary storage (besides RAM).
Explain why RAM is an example of primary storage and not secondary storage.
Describe how virtual memory could be used in this process to stop the computer crashing when RAM becomes full.
Give two features of solid-state (flash memory) storage.
Give two examples of solid-state (flash memory) storage.
Circle three registers that are found in the Von Neumann architecture.
State the purpose of the CPU in the computer.

Computer A: 2.1 GHz quad-core; Computer B: 2.5 GHz dual-core; Computer C: 5.2 GHz single-core. Identify which computer is most likely to execute more instructions simultaneously and justify your answer.
Explain why Computer C can execute more instructions per second than Computer B.
Define the term instruction set.
Identify two other registers that are used in the fetch stage of the cycle.
Complete and annotate the diagram to show how the data is decoded once it has been fetched into the MDR.

Identify one output device that can be built into the smartwatch.

Identify two input devices that can be built into the smartphone.
Identify two output devices that can be built into the smartphone.
Explain the purpose of the secondary storage in the smartphone.
Identify the most suitable type of secondary storage for the smartphone. Explain your choice.

A computer has pages A, B and C that are stored in RAM. Page D needs to be sent to the RAM but the RAM is full. Page B is not needed immediately. Explain how virtual memory can be used in this scenario.
State the purpose of a core in the CPU.
The CPU is replaced with one that has four cores. Explain the effect this has on the performance of the self-checkout system.
Describe the role of a register in the CPU.
Identify one bus that can be found in the CPU and explain its purpose in the fetch–decode–execute cycle.
The self-checkout system allows the user to input their library membership number. Give two appropriate input devices that would allow the user to do this.

The self-checkout system uses a monitor to display information about the book. Users who are blind also need to use the self-checkout system. Give an appropriate output device that would allow a blind user to be given this information.
Circle two types of primary storage that would be used in the system.

Explain the role of the microprocessor in this system and how it is used to update the stock when a book is borrowed.

Describe the purpose of the arithmetic logic unit (ALU).

State the purpose of secondary storage.
Circle three examples of optical storage.
Explain why a computer needs RAM.
Draw and annotate a diagram to show the process of the fetch stage of the FDE cycle.
Identify two input devices that could be built into the portable tablet computer.

A computer has an operating system. One function of the operating system is handling interrupts. (a) Describe the role of the operating system in handling interrupts.
(b) Give two other functions of an operating system.
(c)(i) Hardware and software interrupts are two types of interrupt. Give one example of a hardware interrupt.
(c)(ii) Give one example of a software interrupt.

A programmer writes a program to store and sort all the data for the books in her home library. (a) The programmer uses a high-level language to write the program. One reason for writing the program using a high-level language is that it is easier to read and write. Give two other reasons why the programmer chose to use a high-level language.

(b)(i) The programmer uses an integrated development environment (IDE) to write the program. One function of the IDE is to provide a translator. Complete the statements about translators using terms from the list (e.g., compiler translates the whole code at once before executing it; produces an error report that displays all errors; interpreter translates and executes line by line; stops execution when an error is found, etc.).
(b)(ii) Give two other functions commonly found in an IDE. State the role of each function.
(c)(i) The programmer wants to print a list of all her books on paper. Identify a suitable type of printer that she could use to print this list.

(c)(ii) The programmer needs to connect the printer to her computer. The printer is on the same desk as her computer. Give a suitable method of data transmission that could be used to connect the computer to the printer. Explain your choice.
(c)(iii) An even parity check is used to detect errors in the data after it has been transmitted to the printer. Describe how an even parity check detects an error.
Machine code is one low-level language. Identify one other low-level language and the translator needed for it.
A high-level language can be translated using a compiler or an interpreter. Describe advantages of using an interpreter instead of a compiler during development.
IDEs provide translators. Identify three other common functions of an IDE.

A computer programmer uses an integrated development environment (IDE) when creating a computer program.

Explain the purpose of the IDE.
State what is meant by software.
Tick (✓) one box to show which software is an example of utility software.

State the name of the type of signal sent within the computer to allow multitasking to occur.
Tick (✓) one box to show which statement is a benefit of writing a program in a high-level language instead of a low-level language.
State what the high-level language is translated into.
Identify the translator that converts and executes code line by line.
Identify the translator that creates an error report displaying all errors before execution.
Identify the translator that creates an executable file.
Complete the paragraph about the use of an interrupt in this process.

Give one example of system software.
Give two examples of application software.
Describe the difference between system software and application software.
State the purpose of firmware.
Give one example of firmware.
Give two examples of system software.
Complete the table by writing each missing OS function name and description.

Identify one input device and one example of an interrupt that it can generate.
A processor is currently executing a program. The processor receives an interrupt. Explain how the processor manages the current program and the interrupt.
Describe the difference between system software and application software. Give an example of each.
State which component in the computer would store both types of software when the power is turned off.
Tick (✔) one box to show which statement is correct about writing computer programs in a high-level language.
Describe how the compiler translates the computer program.
Describe how the compiler reports errors.
Give three other common functions of an IDE.

Complete the statements about different types of software: system, application, and utility software.
